bibl.title: Letter from Emma G. Kane to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, [1914?]

div1.p: Kane thanks Sweitzer for a photograph of Lazear and describes the new Jesse Lazear School.

div1.head: Letter from Emma G. Kane to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, [1914?]
div1.p:
I received your letter and
the photo of your son and
we certainly appreciate
your kindness very much

Have delayed in an-
swering and thanking
you for which I hope
you will pardon me.

We have been very
busy but are now nicely
settled in our beautiful
new school house.

The building cost $ 70,000,
and the lot of four acres
$16 000. The building is too
small but can easily be
enlarged. It is a class
A building with all mod-
ern conveniences.

The children are mostly
foreign and we have an
excellent opportunity to
follow the good example
set by our beloved hero
Dr. Jesse W. Lazear. I had
the photo enlarged and
it is hanging in our
hall way. Our children
know the lessons he taught
even better than those
of our heroes that most
children are familiar
with.

The pronounciation of
the name has been some
what of a question.
Will you please send us
the correct one? We are
now calling it Lazear
as in ear. I will try and
send you a cut of the
building later.
div1.closer:
I am
cordially (Miss) Emma G. Kane Principal
Lazear School.
Cor 29 Ave - Elmwood St-
Oakland Cal.
I wrote a letter to Mrs
Lazear at Santa Barbara
but received no reply.
E.G.K.
